title: That items Report CLSCLK23-021, Eastern Ontario Warden's Caucus Presentation; Report IPSENG23-020, Woodglade Boulevard Traffic Operational Review - Sherbrooke Street to Kawartha Heights Boulevard; Report FCSSCS23- 001, New Arena and Aquatics Facility Naming Rights Approval; Report CSAC23- 008, Community Grant History and Future Directions; Report LSCLK23-001, MPP Smith Delegation; Report LSCLK23-002, Programs to Support Vulnerable Populations; Report IPGPL23-002, Mixed-Use Corridors Urban Design Guidelines; Report LSCLK23-003, Appointment by Citizen Appointment Selection Committee, Report IPGPL23-001, Streamline Development Approval Funding Program Update; and, Report MOENV23-001, Proposed New Waste Collection By-law, be approved on Consent.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPSPL23-030, dated October 2, 2023, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: That the subject property be rezoned from R.1 – Residential District to R.2, 10m, 16j – Residential District, in accordance with the draft amendment attached as Exhibit ‘C’ to Report IPSPL23-030.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPSPL23-030, dated October 2, 2023, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: That the subject property be rezoned from R.1 – Residential District to R.2, 10m, 16j – Residential District, in accordance with the draft amendment attached as Exhibit ‘C’ to Report IPSPL23-030. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSCLK23-024, dated October 2, 2023, of the City Clerk as follows: That the presentation from the Peterborough Community Health Centre, be received for information.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPSPL23-030, dated October 2, 2023, of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: That the subject property be rezoned from R.1 – Residential District to R.2, 10m, 16j – Residential District, in accordance with the draft amendment attached as Exhibit ‘C’ to Report IPSPL23-030. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSCLK23-024, dated October 2, 2023, of the City Clerk as follows: That the presentation from the Peterborough Community Health Centre, be received for information. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report FCSSFS23-001, dated October 10, 2023 of the Commissioner of Finance and Corporate Support Services as follows: a) That the 2023 Audit Plan for the Corporation of the City of Peterborough, attached to Report FCSSFS23-001 as Appendix A, be received; and b) That the Mayor and Chair of the Finance Committee be authorized to sign the Audit Planning Report, attached to Report FCSSFS23-001 as Appendix B.

outdoor facilities in accordance with guideline recommendations and mapping strategy as the City continues to expand, to ensure equitable distribution of facilities within the region; f) That staff be directed to create a General Recreation Reserve account to reserve funds to use toward future planning of recreation strategies and general maintenance of active outdoor recreation facilities; and g) That staff be directed to expand existing and seek out new, regional partnerships as additional active outdoor recreation facilities are required in accordance with the recreation strategies. That General Committee approve the recommendation outlined in Report CAOPC23-005, dated October 10, 2023 of the Chief Administrative Officer as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CAOPC23-005 dated October 10, 2023 of the Chief Administrative Officer respecting the Non-Union Employee Group covering the period January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2027.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CAOPC23-007, dated October 23, 2023 of the Chief Administrative Officer as follows: That David J. Potts be appointed as the Commissioner of Legislative Services for the City of Peterborough effective October 23, 2023.

That Peterborough City Council support the request for the immediate release of all documentation pertaining to the 1986 Commission of Inquiry on War Criminals in Canada including an unredacted version of the Rodal report; That a copy of this motion be sent to the Honourable Arif Virani, Minister of Justice and Attorney General of Canada and Honourable Anita Anand, President of the Treasury Board.
23-103 - Being a By-law to amend the Zoning By-law for the lands known as 889 Western Avenue

23-103 - Being a By-law to amend the Zoning By-law for the lands known as 889 Western Avenue That By-laws 23-101, 23-102, and 23-104-106 be approved. 23-101 - Being a By-law to amend the Zoning By-law to remove the ‘H’ Holding Symbol from the Zoning of the property known as 464 Driscoll Terrace 23-102 - Being a By-law to amend the Zoning By-law to remove the "H" - Holding Symbol from the Zoning of the property known as 823 Park Street South 23-104 - Being a By-law to Amend By-Law 13-098 being a By-Law to Designate a Part of a Highway in the City of Peterborough as a Community Safety Zone 23-105 - Being a By-law to Amend By-Law 23-075 being a By-Law to Regulate Speed Limits on Certain Streets in the City of Peterborough 23-106 - Being a by-law to establish a system for the collection of garbage, organic waste, recyclable materials and yard waste
That this meeting be adjourned at 7:25 p.m.
